title: Optical cloaking with metamaterials
abstract: Artificially structured metamaterials have enabled unprecedented flexibility in manipulating electromagnetic waves and producing new functionalities, including the cloak of invisibility based on coordinate transformation. Unlike other cloaking approaches, which are typically limited to subwavelength objects, the transformation method allows the design of cloaking devices that render a macroscopic object invisible. In addition, the design is not sensitive to the object that is being cloaked. The first experimental demonstration of such a cloak at microwave frequencies was recently reported. We note, however, that that design cannot be implemented for an optical cloak, which is certainly of particular interest because optical frequencies are where the word ‘invisibility’ is conventionally defined. Here we present the design of a non-magnetic cloak operating at optical frequencies. The principle and structure of the proposed cylindrical cloak are analysed, and the general recipe for the implementation of such a device is provided.

title: Local polarization of tightly focused unpolarized light
title_cn: 紧密聚焦的非偏振光的局部偏振
abstract: The polarization of light is important in a great variety of optical phenomena, ranging from transmission, reflection and scattering to polarimetric imaging of scenes and quantum-mechanical selection rules of atomic and molecular transitions. Among some less-well-known phenomena that illustrate the vectorial nature of light are the Pancharatnam (or geometric) phase, singularities in the polarization pattern of clear sky and polarization of microwave background radiation. Here, we examine the partial polarization of focused light. We experimentally demonstrate a rather surprising phenomenon, where the focusing of unpolarized light results in rings of full polarization in the focal plane of the focusing optics. The polarization rings are imaged with a resolution of <100 nm by probing the focal region using a gold nanoparticle.
abstract_cn: 光的偏振在各种各样的光学现象中都很重要，从透射，反射和散射到场景的偏振成像以及原子和分子跃迁的量子力学选择规则，不一而足。 说明光的矢量性质的一些鲜为人知的现象包括Pancharatnam（或几何）相，晴朗天空的偏振模式中的奇异性和微波背景辐射的偏振。 在这里，我们检查聚焦光的部分偏振。 我们通过实验证明了一种相当令人惊讶的现象，其中非偏振光的聚焦导致聚焦光学系统的焦平面中的全偏振环。 通过使用金纳米粒子探测焦点区域，使偏振环以＆lt; 100＆＃160; nm的分辨率成像。

title: Low-threshold continuous-wave Raman silicon laser
title_cn: 低阈值连续波拉曼硅激光器
abstract: We report the first demonstration of a low-threshold continuous-wave (c.w.) Raman silicon laser based on a ring-resonator-cavity configuration. We achieved a lasing threshold of 20 mW, slope efficiency of 28% and an output power of 50 mW, with a 25 V reverse bias applied to the p-i-n silicon waveguides. This represents nearly a tenfold improvement in the lasing threshold and more than a fivefold improvement in both slope efficiency and output power over previous results. In addition, we demonstrate for the first time c.w. lasing with zero bias voltage. In this arrangement, the laser does not require an external electrical power supply, and we obtained a lasing threshold of 26 mW and laser output power exceeding 10 mW. The realization of low-threshold lasing and lasing with no external bias is a major advance towards producing practical silicon lasers based on stimulated Raman scattering, for applications ranging from telecommunications and interconnects to optical sensing and biomedical applications.
abstract_cn: 我们报告了基于环形谐振腔配置的低阈值连续波（c.w.）拉曼硅激光器的首次演示。我们在p-i-n硅波导上施加了25＆＃160V的反向偏置，实现了20＆＃160mW的激射阈值，28％的斜率效率和50＆＃160mW的输出功率。与以前的结果相比，这代表着激光阈值提高了近十倍，斜率效率和输出功率都提高了五倍以上。此外，我们首次展示了c.w.零偏压激射。在这种布置中，激光器不需要外部电源，并且我们获得了26＆＃160mW的激射阈值，并且激光输出功率超过10＆＃160mW。低阈值激光和无外部偏置的激光实现是基于受激拉曼散射生产实用硅激光器的重大进展，其应用范围从电信和互连到光学传感和生物医学应用。
